brief_summary.textblock:
This study intends to explore the levels of MSRV expression by analyzing the levels of MSRV
      transcripts in blood, as well as the levels of the MSRV-Env protein in serum in the normal
      population. This study is important for establishing a baseline to analyze results obtained
      in MS patients (another dedicated study is performed in parallel in MS patients). The study
      will be conducted over one year in a cohort of healthy subjects. The MSRV RNA level,
      MSRV-Env protein levels, reverse transcriptase activity, inflammatory markers assessed by
      cytokines levels will be analysed to define control levels in the normal population and
      their variation during one year. The data obtained in this study in healthy controls will be
      compared to those obtained in a parallel similar study, GN-E-002, conducted in different
      types of MS patients.

clinical_study.brief_title: Longitudinal Therapeutically Non-interventional Study of MSRV-Env Burden in Normal Population

study_pop.textblock: Blood donors coming for regular blood draw in the center of transfusion.

facility.name: Etablissement Français du Sang Rhône Alpes - 1 route de Taninges

clinical_study.official_title: A One Year Longitudinal Therapeutically Non-Interventional Study of MSRV-Env Burden in Normal Population as Assessed by PCR and ELISA in Blood

authority: France Competent Authority: Agence Nationale de Sécurité du Médicament (ANSM)
France Ethics Committee: Comité de Protection des Personnes Sud Est V (CPP)

primary_outcome.measure: Establish a control value for the levels of MSRV expression in the normal population over time

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Inflammatory markers and reverse transcriptase activity in blood.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
